item.title: Best Open-World Games That Let You Swim
item.description:
Summary

  • Early open-world games long avoided swimming; today many treat water as a normal, optional surface.
  • Many modern AAA games, like The Witcher 3 , Assassin's Creed Odyssey , Horizon Forbidden West , and GTA 5 , offer swimming, underwater diving, as well as boats and other water traversal tools.
  • Some games include swimming but limit its use; Cyberpunk 2077 and Fallout 4 both feature swimming and diving, but it's almost entirely optional in these games.

Ever since the first open-world games with 3D graphics, swimming has been a rare feature in the genre, often avoided by developers due to technical challenges. Following popular open-world games like Grand Theft Auto 3 and Vice City , open water was often associated with instant death for the protagonist, a common practice to control the player's movement through the world. Even today, despite featuring large explorable maps, not every open-world game offers unrestricted swimming for players, at times avoiding water traversal entirely or relying on vehicles and other means, such as in Red Dead Redemption 2 , rather than character swimming.

Luckily, in many great modern open-world games, players no longer have to fear water. The majority of titles treat water as another surface that players can freely traverse, with unlimited or stamina-based swimming and diving, and include mounts, vehicles, boats, and other options that let players navigate water with no issues whatsoever. Below, we explore some of the best open-world games where swimming is as simple and convenient as walking and running.

For this list, we'll focus on games that feature swimming and diving largely as optional activities or mechanics, rather than titles built entirely around swimming, like Subnautica .

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt

Geralt Can Swim, Use Boats, or Drink Potions to Stay Underwater For Longer

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt
9 /10
56
9.5 /10
Released
May 19, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Use of Alcohol, Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content
Powered by

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt marked a significant step forward from its predecessors, introducing an open world with a multi-region map, horseback riding, as well as swimming and underwater diving to the series. Geralt can use various boats to travel on rivers, explore the sea between the Skellige Islands, and he can swim or dive to retrieve hidden treasures and loot. As a mutant, Geralt can also use a Killer Whale potion to significantly extend the time he can hold his breath underwater.

Interestingly, The Witcher 3 includes underwater combat, enabled by the use of crossbows. Though less effective in other contexts, the crossbow allows Geralt to shoot down flying monsters and easily kill underwater enemies with a well-placed shot.

Assassin's Creed Odyssey

From Customizable Ships to Unlimited Underwater Exploration

Assassin's Creed Odyssey
17
8.7 /10
Released
October 15, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Themes, Strong Language
Powered by

The first Assassin's Creed game lacked swimming mechanics, but starting with Assassin's Creed 2 , the protagonist, Ezio, gained the ability to swim. Since then, almost every game in the series has included swimming in some capacity, with the mechanic being most prominent in Assassin's Creed 4: Black Flag and Assassin's Creed Odyssey , where much of the map is covered in water.

In Assassin's Creed Odyssey , players can command their customizable ship, the Adrestia, for naval combat, use smaller boats for quick traversal, ride mounts to cross rivers, and swim or dive freely anywhere in the ocean. Additionally, acquiring the Legendary Poseidon's Trident grants players the ability to breathe underwater indefinitely, simplifying underwater sections and looting sunken ships.

Horizon Forbidden West

One of the Most Breathtaking Underwater Locales, Plus A Unique Water Mount

Horizon Forbidden West
9 /10
38
8.7 /10
Released
February 18, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Blood, Language, Use of Alcohol, Violence
Powered by

Like in its predecessor, Horizon Forbidden West enhances Aloy's swimming mechanics, expanding on previous features with impressive underwater diving, detailed areas, unique machines to face, and secrets to uncover. Arguably one of the most beautiful open-world games with explorable underwater areas, Horizon Forbidden West includes the Diving Mask, a tool allowing players to breathe underwater indefinitely, similar to Assassin's Creed Odyssey's trident. Without the Diving Mask, players cannot even reach certain areas in Horizon Forbidden West .

Players fond of swimming and diving should also consider the Burning Shores expansion, which introduces the Waterwing, a rideable machine mount for diving patroling beneath the waves. After Aloy learns to hack and control the Waterwing, she can use it for both flying and swift underwater diving and swimming in Horizon Forbidden West , adding an exciting dimension to water exploration.

The Legend Of Zelda: Tears Of The Kingdom

Swimming Coupled With Creative Methods Of Water Traversal

The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom
60
9.2 /10
Released
May 12, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
Rated E for Everyone 10+ for Fantasy Violence and Mild Suggestive Themes
Powered by

Water traversal is a key part of adventure and exploration in both The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild and The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom . Link's swimming ability is stamina-based, so players must be cautious when crossing large lakes or rivers, though it's always feasible. However, neither Breath of the Wild nor Tears of the Kingdom includes underwater exploration.

For open water traversal, The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom takes things to entirely different heights with its robust crafting system through the Ultrahand and Fuse abilities. By mastering these abilities and gathering sufficient resources, players can craft a wide variety of vehicles and mechanisms for crossing the water, limited only by their creativity.

Grand Theft Auto 5

The Gold Standard For Swimming And Water Transport Options In An Open World

Grand Theft Auto 5
9 /10
151
8.9 /10
Released
September 17, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Mature Humor, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
5 Images
Powered by

Following Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas , which introduced swimming to the series, every subsequent GTA game has allowed players to navigate water confidently, and Grand Theft Auto 5 is no exception. Setting a modern standardz for water traversal, GTA 5 offers various options for players to swim or dive and use an array of vehicles in both story mode and GTA Online .

Beyond various ships, boats, yachts, and smaller vehicles like jet skis, Grand Theft Auto 5 includes unique options like personal submarines, rarely seen elsewhere. Undoubtedly, Grand Theft Auto 6 will also feature swimming and diving, along with numerous water traversal vehicles, such as jet skis and various boats, as already seen in game trailers.

Cyberpunk 2077

The Ability To Swim And Dive Is Present But Largely Underutilized

Cyberpunk 2077
6 /10
124
8.9 /10
Released
December 10, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
6 Images
Powered by

While not as prominent as in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt , swimming and underwater diving also made their way into Cyberpunk 2077 . V can freely swim across any water in their path, dive to explore underwater areas in missions like the Pyramid Song quest, and spend time aboard Kerry Eurodyne's yacht (though they cannot pilot it).

While it's good to have swimming in Cyberpunk 2077 , the feature feels underutilized, as there are no player-controlled boats or water vehicles and very few missions involve swimming. Interestingly, Cyberpunk 2077's launch version included the notorious Commando perk, designed to boost players' underwater effectiveness, but it was entirely useless, and was removed in subsequent updates.

Fallout 4

Just Don't Forget to Take Off Power Armor Before Diving

Fallout 4
9 /10
54
8.9 /10
Released
November 10, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M FOR MATURE: BLOOD AND GORE, INTENSE VIOLENCE, STRONG LANGUAGE, USE OF DRUGS
Powered by

Like Fallout 3 and Fallout: New Vegas , the vast world of Boston and its surroundings in Fallout 4 features numerous water areas, including lakes, rivers, and parts of the ocean. Despite many bodies of water being highly radioactive in Fallout 4 , the game supports swimming and underwater diving for players who choose to explore them. Occasionally, swimming and diving are required to complete specific objectives, though such instances are rare.

Players looking to explore underwater in Fallout 4 should follow certain tips. For instance, swimming is only possible without equipping power armor, for obvious weight-related reasons. Additionally, despite the expansive world, there aren't as many notable underwater secrets to uncover in Fallout 4 's waters, which is somewhat disappointing.

item.title: All Characters in Absolum (& How to Unlock Them)
item.description:
Absolum is the right mix of a beat-em-up and a roguelike game. Players will fight hordes of enemies as they progress through each part of the map and unlock upgrades for their character. When they die, they will lose access to their upgrades and have to start the run from the very beginning. However, if they want to mix things up, they can switch characters.

At first, players will only have access to two characters in Absolum , but eventually, they'll unlock another two characters to try out. This guide will show players how they can get all characters in Absolum and provide details on their unique arcanas.

How to Unlock All Characters in Absolum

Players will unlock four characters as they progress through Absolum . Each character has its own strengths and arcanas. Once gamers unlock a new character, they should give them a try on their next run, as it might be more suited for their playstyle. Overall, each character is fun to play in its own way, so they're all worth trying at least once.

Below, we've listed at which point in the game players will unlock a certain character. We've also mentioned the Arcanas that they will have access to. Players can unlock up to seven arcanas per character by speaking to Ederig the Stalwart before starting a run. We will update the list below as we increase our Radiance Level and gain access to more arcanas.

Character

Name

How to Unlock

Arcanas

Galandra

Starting character.

Necrotic Wave - Generate an advancing wave

Phantom Impale - Charge forward, piercing all enemies in your path

Revenge Claw - Execute a claw attack that absorbs and rebounds all incoming attacks for its duration

Burial Smash - After a Run Attack, press X to extend it into a grab and slam

Karl

Starting character.

Grenade Bullet - Launch an explosive grenade in an arc

Firestorm Bullet - Launch a rain of explosive debris

Rifle Bullet - Fire multiple fast bullets

Cider

Defeat the first boss in Absolum to encounter Cider. Restore the bridge. Start another run, go into the forest past the bridge to encounter Cider again, and have them join the team.

Spider Mine - Drop a mine that takes a moment to set up and explodes when an enemy steps on it

Tinker Blade - Shoot blades in a wide arc

Brome

Defeat The Underking in Grandery and then travel to Jaroba. Survive past the two areas and visit the campsite. After this, go on to the next area (the one with a frog marker) to find Brome and have them join the team.

Doom Orb - Conjure an expanding orb of exploding energy

Sigil of Hate - Place a sigil on the ground that summons a magic torrent after a brief interval

Wall of Contempt - Summon a magic wall that protects you from attacks and lets you bounce enemies against it

9 /10

Absolum

item.title: Little Nightmares 3: How to Solve the Radio Puzzle in Carnevale (Chapter Three)
item.description:
Little Nightmares 3's third chapter, The Carnevale, features puzzles and chase sequences that can become tricky to manage. The Radio puzzle is among these, and can be found in the middle portion of the chapter, when Low and Alone enter an abandoned house. The house has a dusty old radio in the center with no signs of life. The goal is to restore power to the radio and somehow find a means to escape this decrepit area. Here's what you need to do.

How to Solve the Radio Puzzle in Little Nightmares 3 (Chapter Three)

Players will encounter the Radio puzzle right in the mid-point of Chapter Three: Carnevale in Little Nightmares 3 . After surviving a row full of monster puppets, Low and Alone will escape the chaos in the carnival tents and enter an abandoned house.

The goal of the Radio puzzle in LN3 is to restore power to the house and find a means to escape. To do that, first enter the hatch on the ground, right in front of the radio. Follow the underground tunnel till you exit through the right side with an empty fuse box .

To find the fuse, use the box to climb the higher platform and use the rope to reach all the way inside the second section of the abandoned house. Inside, you'll spot a fuse atop a shelf. Use Low's bow to shoot the shelf multiple times until it crumbles, and the fuse falls to the ground. Pick it up and throw it through the broken glass on the door to the left.

After throwing the fuse, climb through the door as well. Now, pick the fuse back up and head through the hatch again to the exterior of the building. Insert the fuse into the electrical box and make your way back inside.

The radio will be powered on, and you'll need to turn the crank underneath to adjust its frequency (slowly to shift the needle towards the right). Once the needle is in the right position (indicated in the image above), the power to the house will be restored.

Now, you can't let go of the crank just yet, as the other player will need to use the box to the left to jump and grab the light fixture high up.

As the light fixture shifts slightly down, it'll activate a mechanism and reveal a hidden compartment in the wall . Now, both players can let go of their positions and proceed to climb the newly revealed ladder. This will complete the Radio puzzle in Little Nightmares 3 and allow players to progress further into the story.

Little Nightmares III

item.title: The Best Games Where You Are The Villain's Minion
item.description:
Being the hero can feel a bit... overrated sometimes, but being the villain is also a big responsibility. These games flip the script by putting players right into the shoes of the villain's loyal lackey.

Whether it's running dungeons for some shady corporation, spreading chaos in the name of a dark god, or simply cleaning up the inevitable mess after a world-destroying boss had a bad day, these titles offer a fantastic front-row seat to moralitys darker side. Some take it all quite seriously. Others totally lean into the comedy. And a few let players absolutely revel in the pure power fantasy of being the enforcer for a much, much bigger evil.

Legend Of Keepers

Taking Dungeon HR Seriously

Legend of Keepers
Indie
Strategy
RPG
Systems
Released
March 19, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
M // Blood and Gore, Violence
Developer(s)
Goblinz Studio
Powered by

Legend of Keepers is what happens when dungeon defense has a baby with a corporate life simulator. Players aren't the big, bad, evil boss. Instead, they're the middle management, tasked with keeping the dungeon in tip-top shape. Setting traps, hiring the gnarliest monsters to deal with those pesky adventurers who dare invade its a job.

It's a clever blend of turn-based combat and proper resource management. Players have to balance morale and efficiency, just like a true bona fide evil HR representative. The humor also totally lands, making each "workday" feel like an episode of some dark fantasy sitcom where heroes are just another workplace hazard to manage.

Tyranny

Morality Turned Upside Down

Tyranny
9 /10
Released
November 10, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
t
Developer(s)
Obsidian Entertainment
Powered by

Obsidians Tyranny is a masterclass in role reversal. Players take on the role of a Fatebinder, an enforcer of Kyros the Overlords law. They travel through a conquered land, imposing their rulers will upon his subjects. Instead of trying to overthrow the tyrant, the job here is to make sure their domination sticks .

What makes Tyranny genuinely stand out is how player choices carry serious narrative weight. Players can side with brutal generals, cunning politicians, or even rebel factions, all while somehow still serving the empires interests. It's a story where villainy feels systemic, even ingrained. Players are just one rather important cog in a very oppressive machine, and while they can effect change, saving the world is a long-distant pipe dream.

Star Wars: The Force Unleashed

The Emperors Fist

Star Wars: The Force Unleashed
10 /10
Released
September 16, 2008

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen // Violence
Developer(s)
LucasArts
Powered by

In Star Wars: The Force Unleashed , players embody Starkiller, Darth Vaders secret apprentice. This game is a pure power fantasy through and through. It lets players tear through Rebel forces with spectacular Force lightning, epic lightsaber throws, and gravity-defying combos that make the Dark Side look irresistible.

The story explores Starkillers arc, from loyal assassin to reluctant antihero, but let's be real: the best moments come when players are fully committed to serving Vader. Few games make working for a Sith Lord feel this stylish, giving players the sheer thrill of being the galaxys most dangerous errand runner.

Cult Of The Lamb

Praise Be To The Lamb

Cult of the Lamb
8 /10
11
8.9 /10
Released
August 11, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
Teen / Blood, Violence.
Developer(s)
Massive Monster
Powered by

Cult of the Lamb is deceptively adorable for a game centered around spreading eldritch faith. Players take control of a possessed lamb, saved from death by a mysterious deity, then tasked with building a cult in that deity's name to repay the favor. And repay it they must.

Managing followers, performing dark rituals, and venturing into roguelike dungeons all blend into this strangely wholesome mix of farming sim and evil empire builder. The contrast between its cute visuals and downright sinister undertones makes every sacrifice and sermon feel both hilarious and just a little bit wrong.

Machiavillain

Hollywood Horror, Budget Edition

Platforms

PC

Released

May 16, 2018

Developer

Wild Factor

Genre

Management Sim, Horror

This little indie gem asks players to manage a mansion full of monsters, hiring creatures inspired by classic horror icons and luring unsuspecting victims to gruesome ends. The game borrows quite heavily from Dungeon Keeper , but with a wonderfully dark comedic twist.

Success really relies on following classic horror "rules" as dictated by the League of MachiaVillain Villains; things like letting the virgin live until last, and keeping kills creative enough to earn those precious evil points. Its a management sim that fully embraces campy horror tropes, making villainy feel like a tongue-in-cheek art form.

Henchman Story

Being The Henchman Never Felt This Personal

Platforms

PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X & S, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch, PC, macOS

Released

October 13, 2021

Developer

Silken Sail Entertainment

Genre

Narrative Adventure, Visual Novel

Henchman Story follows Stan, a down-on-his-luck supervillain lackey whos just trying to make rent. Rather than swinging fists and blowing up cities, this visual novel is all about navigating the awkward, messy workplace politics in a world jam-packed with capes and chaos.

What makes Henchman Story stand out is its fantastic humor and surprising heart. Stan could end up a fiercely loyal minion, a reluctant double agent, or he might even forge an unlikely friendship with the very superhero he was supposed to fight. Its a clever, wonderfully self-aware look at what it actually means to work for the bad guys, equal parts comedy and oddly relatable job simulator.

Destroy All Humans! (2020)

Minion, Martian Edition

Destroy All Humans!
7 /10
10 /10
Released
July 28, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
t
Developer(s)
Black Forest Games, Pandemic Studios
Powered by

This modern remake of the cult classic Destroy All Humans! lets players step into the rather large shoes (for his size) of Crypto, an alien tasked with harvesting human DNA and sowing chaos on Earth. While Crypto is technically the protagonist, he's really just a foot soldier in the Furon Empires grand invasion plan.

The joy in this game comes from wreaking utter havoc. UFO abductions, telekinesis, disintegration rays, all unleashed while following orders from the delightfully cynical Orthopox. It's equal parts comedy and destruction. Being the villains loyal alien grunt has rarely been this much fun.

item.title: How to Get the Ghost Face Skin in Fortnite
item.description:
It's October, which means that Fortnite is celebrating one of its most exciting events of the year, Fortnitemares. Throughout the entire month, players will have access to themed weapons, the Item Shop will be riddled with scary skins and spooky cosmetics, and gamers can complete celebratory quests and win free rewards.

When players think of Halloween and scary movies, one of the first that will come to their minds will almost surely be Scream . Ghost Face is among the most popular masks and costumes every year, and now players can dress up as this character in Fortnite . This article tells players what they need to know about the Ghost Face skin and other Scream cosmetics available in Fortnite .

How to Get Ghost Face Skin and Scream Cosmetics in Fortnite

The Ghost Face skin is being sold in the Fortnite Item Shop from October 10 until October 19. Ghost Face costs 1,500 V-Bucks , and it does not include any additional cosmetics. If players want to get more Scream cosmetics, they have to purchase them separately or acquire the Ghost Face item bundle. Here is how much each Scream item costs in Fortnite :

  • Ghost Face skin - 1,500 V-Bucks
  • Ghost Face's Hunting Knife - 600 V-Bucks
  • Ghost Face's Kit back bling - 600 V-Bucks
  • Knife Cleaner emote - 300 V-Bucks

Ghost Face Skins & Cosmetics Showcase

Ghost Face and the rest of the Scream cosmetics will be leaving the Item Shop on October 19 at 7:59 AM . Gamers have until then to decide if they want to purchase any of these items. If not, they will certainly come back to the shop sometime in the future - it's almost guaranteed once the next Fortnitemares rolls around.

To help players decide, here is a showcase of all the Scream items available in Fortnite :

296
8.9 /10

Fortnite
